content.detailedDescription: Driving home on i95 north saw 5 lights - 1 dissappeared then saw others hovering then they all dissappeared one at a time. stopped along road with two other cars. have never seen anything like this.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Saw 6 lights in formation. then each one dissappeared one at a time - no noise.

content.detailedDescription: Objeto cilindrico  oscuro y varias lineas cruzando el cielo de la tarde. el objeto aparece en varias posiciones segun la foto.
content.summary: Objeto cilindrico, solido y oscuro cruzando el cielo. tambien aparecen mas de veinte lineas como formadas por un objeto cruzando el cielo de la tarde.

content.detailedDescription: Objeto cilindrico  oscuro y varias lineas cruzando el cielo de la tarde. el objeto aparece en varias posiciones segun la foto.
content.summary: Objeto cilindrico, solido y oscuro cruzando el cielo. tambien aparecen mas de veinte lineas como formadas por un objeto cruzando el cielo de la tarde.

content.detailedDescription:
I was at my grandmas and i go to the garage and see these alien creatures with big black eyes. and they saw me! i looked at them and they looked at me. 
they were walking towards me i ran inside and locked the door. i saw a flash of light and the creatures were gone.
content.summary: I was at my grandmas and i go to the garage and see these alien creatures with big black eyes.

content.detailedDescription: I was on the deck of my house and looking at the stars.  i noticed a very bright star over my roofline and continued to watch it trying to identify it.  i realized that there were lights pulsating on it in red and blue and it was hovering and moving in somewhat of a zigzag motion on and off.  i brought my son-in-law outside and he observed what i had and we watched the object for about 10 minutes longer when my 16 year old son (a genius but a real skeptic) joined us.  at first, he tried to write it off as some type of star but then saw the pulsating lights and could no longer call it a star.  we continued to watch and he noticed the movement and hovering of the object.  the object was changing altitudes throughout.  we went inside to see if there was anything in the area that may be causing this and when we returned outside a short time later, it was gone.
content.summary: Looked at first to be a very bright star then noticed pulsating lights and zigzag movements

content.detailedDescription: I heard a humming noise so i woke up.(im a light sleeper) i go out-side to see a ufo has landed. a hatch like thing opened and two grey aliens come out they had big black eyes. i got scared so i ran inside and fell back asleep.
content.summary: 3 grey aliens come out of a ufo.

content.detailedDescription: It was around 9:14 pm... i had just got home from work and took my dogs outside into the backyard before getting ready to go to bed. i had an erie feeling as i looked at the full moon since this wasn't the first time that i've seen odd things in the sky. i looked west towards the gulf of mexico and i saw a star like object with a yellow-orange hue. it was sort of glowing and pulsating. it was stationary for the first couple of minutes. a red orb suddenly appeared about 400 yards below the object and was immediately absorbed into it. after the craft in question absorbed the red orb, it got significantly brighter. in addition to this, orange and white hues became more prominant. after the absorbtion, the object slowly descended diagonally. it stopped halfway between where it was and the tree line and hovered for about thirty seconds. it then moved to the left and upward slightly, where it stayed for about ten seconds. it then descended below the tree line. it's unknown whether or not it landed. it just descended until i could no longer see it. i was extremely unsettled. i called for my mom, but she didn't see any of it. the rest of the night was uncomfortable.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Large star like craft absorbs red orb than glows and pulsates greater, follwed by slow decent

content.detailedDescription:
There is a cat in my apartment that started acting strangely at the window.  i went outside of my rooftop apartment and 2 very bright stars caught my eye.  quickly i realized they were moving and i tracked them across the sky.  they were moving together about 4-5 inches apart relative to my observation point.  i believe the altitude was quite significant at 90,000 or more feet high.  the lights tracked almost directly over me and i continued to observe them as they headed north.  i followed them for 20 - 30 seconds as they were now probably 40 miles, or more, north of my rooftop vantage point, one of the lights abruptly veered toward the other light.  the second light seemed to give way and they continued very close together into the horizon and out of view.  

since then, i have tracked several commercial aircraft that followed the same approximate course.  it takes a regular commercial jet about 4 minutes to complete the path that these lights covered in about 20 - 30 seconds tops.   no noise, no exhaust, no flames,. abrupt veering.   my roof-top vantage point made this sighting quite extraordinary, indeed.   interestingly, when i tried to call my friend to tell her about it, we encountered some cell phone problems.
content.summary: Observed two star - like lights, but somewhat brighter and larger, traveling across the sky.  i est speed greater the 6000 mph, with abrupt direction changes.

content.detailedDescription: It was a very clear night with unlimited visibility.  i was testing some night vision equipment, viewing several inbound and outbound commercial and civilian air traffic.  i then focused my attention on two bright stars/planets in the southern sky, then on the horizon to fine tune the focus of the equipment.  i then observed a high altitude commercial flight with a contrail, which would have been invisible to the naked eye, with exception to the anti-collision lights.  finally i panned down to view the moon, which was a low crescent near the two brightest stars/planets in the southern night sky.  since the stars were extraordinarily bright when observed through the night vision, i panned slightly to the west and caught a glimpse of what i initially perceived to be some type of aircraft, traveling at high speed in a trajectory, parallel to the horizon, slightly away from my position.  as a trained observer by profession, oriented and familiar with all types of aircraft, it quickly became apparent that i was observing some type of an unconventional craft, totally unfamiliar to me.  had i not been utilizing night vision, i would have never seen the object.  the object was elongated, appeared a dull gray, with no appendages or flight surfaces.  the object was traveling at a high velocity, parallel with the horizon and appeared to reflect, what i believed to be the moonlight off of the top portion of the cylinder.  the object emitted no interior or exterior illumination, with no visible windows.  after tracking the object for approximately 4 second, i observed some type of concave haze on the front of the object that appeared as some type of front illumination or light was being projected from the front of the object, similar to the haze that appears on the wings of tactical fighter aircraft as they pull excessive g forces.  as this occurred, the object quickly disappeared as though it passed behind an invisible barrier.  extremely unusual...Have never witnessed this type of event before.
content.summary: Cigar  or could have been disk shape viewed from edge

content.detailedDescription:
Went to bed at around 11pm & could not sleep as it was too hot. got up at around 3am and read a while, and started getting sleepy, so switched lights off and went to kitchen to get glass of water. as i was drinking the water, i looked out at the stars - one of them was particularly bright - about a quarter of the size of venus and about half as bright. it attracted my attention as it was sort of strobing - going from white to blue to white to blue. as i watched, it moved in what looked like a circular pattern.
i rubbed my eyes, thinking i was seeing things, but it moved again - this time in an irregular circular pattern, and the movement was definite, as i could guage it from the edge of the tree silhouette outside.
thinking it may be something to do with the window glass, i rushed outside and confirmed that it was moving from time to time.
i had a sighting just a month previously (fortunately witnessed by my wife) and had not managed to take a photo of that one, so i rushed inside and got my digital camera, zoomed to its maximum and got two shots of it. the image is unfortunately so small as to be virtually useless as the object was approximately 20km away (near as i could tell, but that may be incorrect).
it's height was around 45 degrees from the horizon, bearing plus minus north, north east (i checked my compass).
my first thought was that it was a star, and because it was low on the horizon, it was being severely distorted and giving the illusion of moving, but then i noticed a star just near it that was not moving at all!
my second thought was maybe it was an aircraft, as it was hovering above the approximate position of the durban airport - the trouble with that theory is that it maintained its position for over an hour!
then i saw what i can only describe as an 'auroric' effect, starting about 5km from the object, contracting in to the object. this only happened once. directly after this, i saw 'incoming' golden orbs streaking in from about a 10km radius to the object, and then from the object away from it and disappearing at about the same distance. i saw lots of them and lost count at 41.
these orbs came in towards and out of the object at all angles or directions.
the object did strange irregular manauvers at irregular intervals every minute or two.
at 4:31am it dimmed suddenly to a tiny speck for a minute or so, and then returned to its original brightness. i searched for any sign of clouds, but could see none. it should be noted that being near the sea, there is a lot of humidity, so there is a chance there was some fine cloud that i could not observe that may have obscured it momentarily, but it only happened once, so i have my doubts it was cloud.
at exactly 4:44 it moved up to about 22,000 feet - that is about 2,000 feet from its original position. this was a marked change in altitude, and put away my thoughts of it being a star affected by atmospheric interference completely. please remember these distances i have quoted are suspect, as it was difficult to guage any sort of distance in relation to the object, which was too far to make out if it had any particular form or not.
at 5:03am it faded into nothingness and did not reappear.
during this time i took my telescope outside, but the objects movements were such that i could not track it or get a decent view of it - the telescope is not of high quality, and of the type used for casual lunar observation.
i was quite critical of my thinking during this time as i had seen a very clear ufo about a month previously (also reported on this site), and thought i may be experiencing some sort of 'ufo' fever - where one starts to imagine that any and everything one sees in the sky is suspect. hence the included thoughts i had of what it could rationally be.
nevertheless, the observation does not add up to anything rational, and i think there is a real chance it was a craft of sorts, but i cannot truly say if it was.
content.summary: Star like - flashing white then  blue at regular intervals

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving truck down 146s in woonsocket area i looked to the north and saw a fast moving light blue in color at about 1215am it cleared the sky in about four seconds never saw anything move that fast it was oval in shape glowing whitish blue it headed south i know there is an airport that way but it was close to the tree tops to low to be a plane 
it was some thing to see
content.summary: It moved across sky very fast not a plane i've worked at airport fueling planes it wasn't no strobe lights visable blue in color very bright

content.detailedDescription: I was with some friends hanging out by my place, i noticed the object when my friend pointed out that there was a bright light. then i immediately turned around and saw it, at first it was just one multi-color changing orb, then another appeared out of no where right next it; and then a third one on top of both of them. they all changed color very quickly, and had a fire looking kind of touch to it. eventually two of them faded a little bit, and moved away from each other while the one on top of them elevated even higher and in the sky and stayed there. 10 minutes later the other two came back. and at a flash i saw two blue lights right next to the two orbs that had just came back, these blue ones were very quick. they were gone in a blink. i was very amused because i enjoy these kinds of things, they're mysterious.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Several multi-color changing orbs, dissappeared several times, then came back.

content.detailedDescription: We were riding along interstate 90 in massachusetts,about an hour and a half outside of boston, traveling west. i was looking out of the window and suddenly had the impulse to look up into the sky and the clouds. the day was lovely, but i'm not someone who scans the sky, and i just felt like i was searching for something--almost like i was "supposed to"(which sounds weird, i know.) then i noticed, high up against the sky, at the edge of a cloud, an object flying parallel to the  road, just under the clouds. it was silent, it had no trail and no wings that i could see, and it was a brighter white than any planes i have seen in the sky. it didn't appear reflective, but it was so high up that it was hard to tell. i couldn't see any details, but it was solid and more "outlined" that things usually seem to me that high up. it was only visible for a minute or so until it entered a cloud and was no longer visible.
content.summary: Silent, cigar-shaped, reflective, white/blue/grey, parrallel to the road, no trail, no wings, too high to see details.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife, son (12yo) and i were in our back yard last night with a low fire in our chimnea enjoying a clear night star-gazing (we had a telescope out and were observing jupiter, venus, and a low moon before this event). we were talking when my wife pointed to the sky nearly directly overhead and asked what "that is". my son and i both looked and we all three watched a faint crescent shaped (my wife called it "crab shaped", it did look something like a crab floating across the sky) object move silently across the sky in a north-west direction in a straight line, disappearing behind my neighbor's house. the object was faint, did not appear to have discrete lights, it looked as if it was glowing or reflecting light. to be honest it looked like  would expect a silvered mylar balloon would look reflecting fire light. the shape of the thing was crescent but seemed to have feathered edges on it's wings. so a bird or balloon make sense except it couldn't have been either in our opinion, the apparent speed and course ruled out balloon and it just didn't seem like a bird. i have never reported a ufo, and never claimed to have seen one. i have never in my 45 years seen anything in the sky i couldn't explain. i am a scientist by education, and an engineer by trade, working in the aerospace field. i am also a photographer, and know a think or two about lighting, light sources, and reflections. i am also familiar with aircraft, military and civilian, as well as spacecraft and meteorological phenomena. i cannot explain what we saw last night.

i report this to add to your observation database. i would love to hear more about similar sightings if they exist.
content.summary: Crescent or chevron-shaped object, luminous or reflective, silent

content.detailedDescription: I was driving along the mulligan highway just after dusk and i saw a bright red light that appeared from no where (above the trees on the left hand side of the road) it hovered for like 10 seconds and it landed then disappeared into thin air and left no trace.  very strange!!
content.summary: Driving along the mulligan highway and light appeared.

content.detailedDescription:
My friend and i were out in his front yard just after midnight talking politics when a passing object overhead caught my attention.  the object was moving in a south to north directions passing almost directly overhead.  i first noticed the object when it was about 70 degrees overhead and viewed the object for about 2-3 seconds until it disappeared at about a 45 degree angle of view.  i could not estimate the actual altitude, size or speed of the object, but the apparent altitude appeared to be the same height of a small personal air craft or helicopter, so maybe a 1000 ft up and the apparent size of the object was 2" wide.  i did not see a length.  it did not make any sounds.

the shape of the object i observed is best describe with the following keyboard character { or however, there was not a point in the middle of the shape.  all i saw was the leading edge of the object which almost looked like thick smokey white condensation (such as con-trails from an aircraft), but this was on the leading edge of the "wing(s)" and it did not trail, only highlighted the leading edge as it traveled.  another way to describe it would be it looked similar to the leading edge of a search light shining in the sky at night.

when i first saw the object i remember thinking that the white i was seeing just appeared out of no where and how much is stood out and contrasted with the night sky, which was clear last.  i immediately thought of the ufo's over illinois tv show and and yelled at my friend to turn around and look up it's a ufo.  by the time my friend turned around and looked the object had disappeared.  the only rational non-ufo explanation i could think of was a search light shining from some club or bar promotion, but we monitored the sky of any more search lights and saw none.  plus the object moved in a straight line, no circular pattern, and it was only the leading edge and not a semi or full circle. 

i knew instantly what saw was not a normal aircraft.  i was pumped after seeing it and kept describing what i was over and over to my friend and then his wife.
content.summary: Shape most resembled {

content.detailedDescription: While at a chili cook off with some of my wifes friends, one of them looked up into the sky and said whats that? a group of us looked up and saw a orb like object moving from the southern sky north at maybe 1000 ft moving quickly north, it had a greenish/yellow/ orange glow, we saw it for maybe 10 seconds, we moved across the yard to see if we could watch it come out the other side of a group of trees but it was gone.This was st patricks day, this event took place in northglen colorado,last night march 24th i was outside cheking out the nice crescent moon with jupiter and venus shining brightly above the moon, i thought i would snap a few photos quickley, i didnt have my glasses on and the photos came out crappy, the moon and the planets were just squigly lines, as were some of the neighbor hood lights, but in the photos there were orbs, that were not visible when i took the photos, but were there when i downloaded the pictures to my computer, i checked the camera lens for dirt, dust or anything that would have created the orbs, but the lens was clean, why arent they distorted like the moon, planets and other lights in the photos? and these orbs are a match to the one seen by multipul witnesses the week before 25 miles south of this location, perhaps they are just a reflection or something else from the camera, i dont know, but very interesting to say the least, dave b.
content.summary: Straight line flight  multipul witnesses

content.detailedDescription: I was about to walk outside for my break and my manager was outside already seeing these things in the sky. i came out and saw what looked like red flashing stars flying over the building. i pulled out my phone and began to record. some of the objects seemed to be flying to close together to be planes and they were flying slow. i immediately thought it had to be military planes because i knew it was not regular planes. i recorded 7 objects flying but there were more before i began recording.They sort of just disappeared into the night.
content.summary: Line of glowing red lights

content.detailedDescription: @ 10:00 spotted super bright starlike / plane light in nw sky, it dimmed to smaller than star the 4x brighter than venus until about 10:30 it dimmed a total of 5-7x, it appeared as if was dissapearing behind clouds when there were no clouds for it to go behind.
content.summary: Starlike/ plane light like at first, very bright 4x brighter than venus, then dims to less bright than small star then back again super bright.

content.detailedDescription: @ 10:00 spotted super bright starlike / plane light in nw sky, it dimmed to smaller than star the 4x brighter than venus until about 10:30 it dimmed a total of 5-7x
content.summary: Starlike/ plane light like at first, very bright 4x brighter than venus, then dims to less bright than small star then back again super bright.

content.detailedDescription: It was approx. 5pm and i was was laying on the couch talking on the phone looking through the back living room window through some trees out back and noticed lights through the trees in the sky. they were as bright as a planet is at night, i would say as bright as venus even. they moved slowly in various directions. i took a video camera out to the front of the home and video taped a few minutes of the event, using a tripod as well for a brief time for a stable shot. the objects moved slowly east over the ocean until they were out of sight approx. 45 minutes later. there was other witnesses besides me and we all were asking what they were.
content.summary: 5 daytime objects glowing moving slowly across the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
On 3-24-12 at approx. 2028 hrs. i was standing on my deck facing north/northeast and observed several approaching lighted objects in the sky in a southwest direction.  the objects appeared to be orangish in color caused by a white/red light.  the objects were spaced approx. 1/2 to 1 mile apart, were silent, and all but two extinghished their lights when they reached a point east of my residence.  there was an airliner high in the sky traveling in and east/west direction, and the last two objects, although much lower in the sky (1500-2500) feet agl, extinguished their light prior to a "visual" intersection with the plane.  the last object acuatlly appeared to possibly hover momentarily before smoothly going what appeared vertical and extinshishing its light on the way up well in advance of a visual intersection with the highflying airliner.
i at first thought the objects were several planes or helicopters in a linear group flying in the same direction, but these objects were silent, and extinguished their lights.  i live close to an airport, and these lights were just as bright in the sky, and as low as most approaching aircraft to the airport.
content.summary: Approx. 6-7 lighted objects traveling in same direction less than a mile apart from each other.

content.detailedDescription:
On saturday, march 24, 2012, i was visiting with 3 friends in the ahwatukee foothills village neighborhood of phoenix. in the evening, 3 of the 4 of us made a fieldtrip to a convience store to replenish refreshmints, while the 4th stayed behind to watch children. at 7:38 pm, while i and 2 of these friends were walking southbound on 48th street, south of chandler blvd and north of frye road, we observed several orange-red lights in the sky. the lights were low on the horizon and formed a diagonal pattern. this pattern was highest on the east at approximately 35 degrees elevation and sloped down at an angle of approximately 45 degrees. in all, 6-8 individual lights were in this formation. these lights moved together from west to east at a low rate of speed. as we continued to watch these lights, i pulled up my phone to get video.

within seconds of this initial sighting, i and one of my friends noticed multiple additional lights lower on the horizon and further to the west. first we saw 2 lights, then a third. afterward, more lights continued to appear behind and to these. the newer lights did not move in a tight formation but rather were jumbled and appeared to be moving in different directions, ascending, descending, approaching, and going. while we watched the new lights, i continued to fumble with my phone.

eventually, i got my phone to begin recording, and i moved forward, walking into the shadow of some trees, out of the glaring streetlights. meanwhile, my friends stayed behind. one called his girlfriend, who had stayed behind in the apartment while we had made our fieldtrip to the convience store. as i walked forward into the darkness, more lights emerged. i could see at least 4 additional lights higher in the sky than any of the others. these were to the west of the diagonal formation and above the second cluster. like the second group, these lights did not move in a synchronized manner.

after seeing these, i darted across the street and continued further down the road to see more. then i observed a smaller group of what appeared to be 3 lights at a similar height but off to the east side of the diagonal. upon making this observation, i noted that a woman who was jogging down the road had stopped about 100 yards south of my position and was also observing the sky. meanwhile, traffic continued to pass by without the drivers seeming to notice our behavior (or at least not stopping in response). 

the lights on the east side appeared to be moving to the west but also away from me, to the south. however, lights low on the horizon, on the west side of the group, were clearly moving from west to east at a higher rate of speed (at least relative to my perspective). the lights in the diagonal formation appeared stationary or moving away (south). the lights high and to the west were moving from west to east before possibly turning more to the south. i say this, because the lights eventually faded or turned away.

after i had crossed over the street and observed the 3 lights on the eastern side, i noted the movements of the lights and returned to my friends. as i was having no luck getting the lights to show on my camera phone, i was hoping my friends were more fortunate. while i was returning to them, i witnessed most of the lights fading or turning away from me. however, a few of them initially continued on their west to east track before appearing to either turn to the south or disappear (possibly behind a mountain). i followed one in particular which was the brightest. it lingered until i was very close to my friends and finally blinked out right before my eyes.

in all, i believe i saw approximately 18 lights moving around the sky. what we saw did not seem to fit with anything that any of us had seen before. these lights did not match the videos of the original phoenix lights. the lights were potentially over the barry goldwater range but may also have been north of there. from our position we could not tell if they were over the estrella mountains or further south. if the lights were over the range, the aircraft we saw were presumably flying high enough for us to see them over the estrella mountains and/or any other mountains between us.

these objects weren't following any of the usual airline traffic patterns and did not have the same lights as commercial aircraft. we could see other aircraft coming in to approach phoenix skyharbor internation airport and other regional airports at the time of this sighting, and these lights were in a very different area, displaying different colors, and behaving very differently.

the lights did not behave like military jets or helicopters i have observed, and i did not see navigation lights or strobes. given that we did see the orange-red lights, the activity did not appear to be a "lights-out" exercise.

these objects also did not behave like meteorites.

we know there is a major sailport in the area near estrella mountain. this sailport is popular for skydiving and may have been used for a night jump. along the same line, people also enjoy driving or even hiking to high points in south mountain regional park to parasail. however, these lights lingered for more than 8 minutes, and several moved directly from west to east under their own power. 

at this time, the most likely explanations i have involve aircraft and flares. we may have seen a military exercise in the distance over the goldwater range. perhaps atmospheric conditions distorted our perception of the color and behavior of the aircrafts' and flares' lights. we may have seen a semi-organized aerial caravan of reverse snowbirds flying south for the summer. we may have seen a spoiled group of television labcoats testing eccentric theories for recreating the original phoenix lights.

unfortunately, neither i nor either of my friends seem to have had any luck capturing them on film. however, i have not tried enhancing my video file, so i would be willing to give that a go. hopefully, someone else saw something tonight and can shed some light on this event. i am sure there is a good explanation to what was up there. whatever it was, it was interesting to watch.
content.summary: With 2 friends observed approximately 20 lights travel from west to east across sky south of the ahwatukee foothills village neighborhood of phoenix

content.detailedDescription: Heading north to lubbock from seagraves texas, i seen a shinny metallic disk or bullet shaped object at my 2 o'clock (east bound heading in the direction of dallas) moving what seemed to be a slow speed,based on size and distance, i would guess speed of 400mph, it was hard to make out the shape because of distance, but certainly not a plane, balloon, helicopter, or birds, no contrails. sighting lasted less than 2 minutes due to the object just disappeared, on a clear afternoon, not a cloud in the sky. i continued to watch the sky for 20 minutes with no reappearance of object.
content.summary: Right outside seagraves texas heading west i seen a metallic object moving what seemed to be slow, my eyes never left the object, and then within a blink of my eye disappeared, not a cloud in the sky.

content.detailedDescription: My sister, her boyfriend and i were driving home from a play. we were about to turn on our street when her boyfriend noticed two blue dots in the sky blinking from, red to white then back to blue. at that moment they were just stationary hoering in the sky, about a mile away. when i looked over at them i saw one of the dots, they were roughly to where a plane would be in the sky, drop in a straight line, unbelievably fast, to an abrut stop. it dropped to just about the top of the house below it. after a few seconds the other dot proceeded to do the same as the previous one. the objects then started to dart back and forth in a straight line at the height they stopped at. after a couple seconds of this the objects just dissappered. the first thing that entered our minds was ufo, that could be the only plausible explanation. the excitement that came over me the moment i saw the objects was unreal, i knew what i was seeing was a ufo, no doubt in my mind about it.
content.summary: It was at the height a plane would be, two blue dots big blinking red, blue and white, then like soooo fast faster then an eye blink on drops straight down to about the houses, then after a few secs the other one does. after the just start going in a stra

content.detailedDescription: We were standing outside when a lady driving by stopped and asked if i was looking at what was in the sky, i looked up and seen apx. 30-50 orange like lights moving in a sequensial path sorta moving slowlike/hovering. she stopped cause she thought she was seeing things my bro. and i seen it also this was around 8: 30-8:40 we followed and kept a eye on the objects but while looking at them they just faded right in front of us into the darkness at first i thought they were army helicopters b/c of the formation they were in, it looked similar of that.Im a person who has to see to believe, and it really gave me the chills at that time going through the experience it was really crazy.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Over 30-50 small orange lights flying in seq. pattern then diss.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were traveling from pikeville, kentucky to inez, kentucky on us route 23 and had just were passing deskins motors, a dodge, jeep dealership on the left side of the 4 lane highway. i was looking at cars on the lot as i was driving by and my wife told me to look up in the air. when i did i saw at least 8 white/yellow glowing orbs in the sky about what i would guess to be at least 500 to 1000 feet in the air at about what i would guess to be about 1/2 mile away. they were in a random pattern but were grouped together loosely. two of the orbs were moving in a slow counter clockwise motion and a couple more were moving slowly up and down. the rest were hovering. i pulled the car over on the side of the 4 lane and my wife and i got out of the car to look. i am 45 years old and never have seen anything like this. i thought at first the lights were search lights on helicopters but they were closes enough to make noise enough to be heard. the circular pattern the orbs were moving in were too fast to be done smoothly by a helicopter. this display lasted about 5 minutes then the orbs moved into a stacked formation and slowly ascended one after the other into the low cloud cover and we could no longer see them. i never reported this to anyone else except friends because it occurred on 9/11/11 and i could not say if they were some kind of aircraft. i really believe these were not aircraft due to the manuevers these orbs were making so smoothly. my wife and i are not seeking attention we would just like an explanation or to know if we were the only ones who saw this. my wife said others pulled off and looked but i do not remember this because i was a little shaken and still am. i always thought i would be less disturbed because i grew up in florida and have seen rocket launches to the moon while i was growing up.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: I and my wife saw glowing orbs in the sky in pike county kentucky while travelling on a 4 lane highway on 9/11/11. nothing was reported on the news the next day

content.detailedDescription:
I was cooking dinner this evening when my husband came inside telling me to come out and look up at the sky. at first i thought it had to be venus because of its location in the sky to the left of our front porch, but it was pulsing randomly, getting extremely bright and then fading away to blackness before coming up again. there were storms off to the front of the house in the distance, and the sky in the area of the light was relatively clear, with some patchy clouds passing over. the light was so bright that it had no problems shining straight through the clouds where the stars around it appeared dim and were covered completely when the clouds passed over. i also noticed a couple of times that as it grew brighter, there seemed to be projections that came off of it. it looked a lot like the plumes you might see coming up off of the sun, so i thought for sure it had to be some celestial/planetary body and the reason for the pulsing was because of atmospheric disturbances. i stayed out on my front porch watching it for some time while my husband took some 30-second time lapse shots on his nikon d80. at one point, a plane passed above the object. there were definitely no other lights on the light i was seeing as on a plane. the orb was definitely a ways off, but its position was well above the trees where i could see it clearly. it kept pulsing that way for a while before i went back inside. about 20-30 minutes later i got curious and went back out to find that it was gone. i called my husband out and as we stood looking for it, we realized that it wasn't gone. it had simply moved to a new location. it was now just visible through the top of the big pine tree to the left of our house. it had previously been well above the top of that tree and was perceptibly moving around. this was when i really started to wonder exactly what it could be...I haven't gone back out to see if it is there or whether or not it has simply moved, but i'm wondering if there is anyone else in our area who saw it as well. maybe it's a meteor given the fact that it moved to another location? i'm really not sure. can't say for sure that it's intelligent, but it's definitely strange.

you can zoom in on the photo and see that the trail of the object does not move in the same direction as the stars around it. the trail actually changes direction in many of the photos that were taken, this was just a sample shot. i hope to get more of them side by side so that the movements might be tracked.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Unknown
content.summary: Light appears star-like, but larger, much brighter, dims, disappears, and pulses a bright white again. does not move with the other stars, but rather randomly.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
My mom told me to come out side. i did, didn't see nothing for about 7 minutes, about to go back inside and seen it! then called my girlfriend and seen another one like 7 minutes.

it was really dark and could barely see it as the sky isn't completely dark, so i seen it cause it was darker then the sky... it's trim was silverish, made no noise, was really close and right above me, my mom, and girlfriend. it was traveling like at say 40-60mph so fairly slow for an aircraft. it also hovered stationary for a while. i have pictures but the craft couldn't be picked up in the photo as it was dark outside... if anyone else seen it, tell me! my grandma also seen the first one with my mom but went inside.
content.summary: No lights, no sound, no nothing. just black and barely visible at night with a sliver trim. slow moving
